name: lazyjournal
description: A TUI for reading logs from journald, auditd, file system, Docker containers, Compose stacks, Podman and Kubernetes pods with support for output coloring and multiple filtering modes.
readme_summary: Lazyjournal is a terminal user interface (TUI) tool written in Go for reading logs from various sources like journald, auditd, file system, Docker containers, Podman, and Kubernetes pods. It provides features like output coloring and multiple filtering modes, enabling users to efficiently analyze and monitor logs from different systems in a centralized manner.
key_features: Simple installation with a single executable file
Centralized search across multiple log sources
Streaming output of new log events (like `tail`)
List of systemd units with their status for log access
primary_use_case: Centralized log monitoring and analysis from various sources (systemd, Docker, Podman, Kubernetes) using a terminal-based interface.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a librarian meticulously organizing scrolls from different lands (representing various log sources like Docker, Kubernetes, systemd) into a central, glowing archive. The librarian uses a magical lens to filter and color-code the scrolls, making them easily readable. UI elements float around the librarian, displaying filtering options and real-time log streams. The scene is set in a futuristic library with soft, ambient lighting. Small code snippets and data visualizations are subtly embedded in the walls. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear details.

name: browserforge
readme_summary: BrowserForge is a Python library that generates realistic browser headers and fingerprints. It aims to mimic real-world web traffic patterns, providing developers with tools to avoid detection when scraping or automating tasks. It is a reimplementation of Apify's fingerprint-suite in Python.
key_features: Uses a Bayesian generative network to mimic actual web traffic
Extensive customization options for browsers, operating systems, devices, locales, and HTTP version
primary_use_case: Generating realistic browser headers and fingerprints for web scraping and automation to avoid detection.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled forger meticulously crafting browser fingerprints in a hidden workshop. The forger uses a complex machine with dials representing different browser settings, operating systems, and devices. Completed fingerprints, glowing with authenticity, are carefully placed onto digital passports. UI elements showing browser header code subtly float around the scene. The workshop is dimly lit with a focused spotlight on the forger's work. The image should be in a detailed 3D isometric illustration style with a color scheme of blues, greens, and grays, emphasizing precision and sophistication.

name: PdfItDown
readme_summary: PdfItDown is a Python package designed to convert various file formats, including Markdown, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, HTML, text-based formats (CSV, XML, JSON), ZIP files, and image files (PNG, JPG), into PDF documents. It leverages libraries like markitdown, markdown-pdf, img2pdf, and LlamaIndex to achieve format-specific conversions, offering both a command-line interface and a Python API for flexible usage.
key_features: Converts Markdown to PDF using markdown-pdf
Converts images to PDF using img2pdf
Converts text-based formats to PDF using LlamaIndex-compatible readers (defaults to MarkItDown)
Provides a command-line interface (CLI) for easy conversion
Offers a Python API for integration into scripts
Supports bulk conversion of files in a directory
Allows setting the title in the PDF metadata
primary_use_case: Converting various file formats (Markdown, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, HTML, text-based formats, ZIP files, and image files) to PDF.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan in a workshop meticulously transforming various documents (scrolls, blueprints, photos, spreadsheets) into neatly bound PDF books. The artisan uses specialized tools that glow with digital energy, subtly converting each format. UI elements float around the scene, showing snippets of code and file formats. The workshop is filled with organized shelves and soft, diffused lighting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and rich details. The repository name, 'PdfItDown', is subtly engraved on a tool.

name: local-dream
description: Run Stable Diffusion on Android Devices with Snapdragon NPU acceleration. Also supports CPU/GPU inference.
readme_summary: Local Dream is an Android application that allows users to run Stable Diffusion models on their devices. It supports Snapdragon NPU acceleration for faster inference, as well as CPU/GPU inference. The application provides features like text-to-image generation, image-to-image transformation, and inpainting.
primary_use_case: Running Stable Diffusion models on Android devices for image generation and manipulation.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan chiseling a detailed sculpture of a majestic android from a block of stone, representing the power of Stable Diffusion on Android. The android sculpture is partially glowing with digital particles, showing its transformation from raw material to advanced technology. UI elements from the Local Dream app subtly appear on the stone block, showing the app's interface. The scene is set in a bright, modern workshop with soft, diffused lighting. The composition is clean and focused with a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details.

name: fzfm
readme_summary: fzfm is a fuzzy finder file manager that allows users to navigate directories and open files using the keyboard. It leverages `fzf` for fuzzy searching and provides file and directory previews, along with customizable media opening and text editing capabilities.
key_features: Navigate directories seamlessly using only your keyboard
primary_use_case: Efficient file and directory navigation and management within a terminal environment.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian in a vast, glowing digital library uses a magical magnifying glass (fzf) to instantly locate a specific book among millions. The magnifying glass highlights the desired book with a bright aura. Around the librarian, screens display file previews (bat) and directory structures (eza). The librarian uses a universal key to open the book (media opener). The library is filled with floating data particles and subtle UI elements. The scene is set in a futuristic library with soft, ambient lighting. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: packemon
description: Packet monster („Å£‚Äò-‚Äô)‚ïÆ=ÕûÕüÕüÕû‚óí  „ÉΩ( '-'„ÉΩ)  TUI tool for sending packets of arbitrary input and monitoring packets on any network interfaces (default: eth0). Windows/macOS/Linux
readme_summary: Packemon is a TUI tool written in Go for generating and monitoring network packets. It allows users to craft and send custom packets to any network interface and simultaneously monitor network traffic, filtering and inspecting packets in detail. The tool supports Windows, macOS, and Linux.
key_features: Packet monitoring on any network interface
primary_use_case: Network packet generation and analysis for security testing, network debugging, and protocol analysis.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan meticulously crafting miniature paper airplanes, each representing a network packet, and launching them into a swirling vortex of digital data streams. The artisan uses a magnifying glass to examine each plane's structure, ensuring it carries the correct information. Some planes are intercepted by a glowing net, representing packet monitoring. Small UI elements displaying packet details float around the scene. The setting is a whimsical workshop filled with tools and blueprints. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and intricate details.

name: quiet
description: A private, p2p alternative to Slack and Discord built on Tor & IPFS
readme_summary: Quiet is a decentralized, peer-to-peer team chat application built on Tor and IPFS, offering an alternative to Slack and Discord. It prioritizes privacy by syncing data directly between team members' devices without relying on a central server.
primary_use_case: Private and secure team communication without a central server.
cover_image_prompt: A group of diverse individuals sitting around a round table, each connected to a central, glowing Tor node via secure, invisible threads. The Tor node acts as a silent messenger, relaying encrypted messages between them. Each person has a laptop displaying a simple chat interface. Digital particles representing encrypted data flow smoothly between the laptops and the Tor node. The scene is set in a cozy, futuristic library with soft, ambient lighting. Small UI elements and the 'Quiet' logo are subtly integrated into the laptops. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with a warm color scheme and clean, modern design.

name: enchat
description: End-to-end encrypted, ephemeral, self-hosted terminal chat ‚Äî no accounts, no history, no cloud.
readme_summary: Enchat is a terminal-based chat application that provides end-to-end encrypted communication with a focus on privacy and security. It offers features like secure room creation, file sharing, perfect forward secrecy, Tor support, and a zero-knowledge architecture, ensuring that messages are protected from eavesdropping and data harvesting.
primary_use_case: Secure and private terminal-based communication without accounts or data retention.
cover_image_prompt: A medieval messenger, cloaked and hooded, whispering secrets into a glowing terminal interface. The terminal displays encrypted text, with digital locks and keys floating around the screen. The messenger stands in a dimly lit, secure vault, with code snippets subtly etched onto the stone walls. The scene emphasizes privacy and secure communication. The repository name, 'Enchat,' is subtly displayed on a banner in the background. The image should be in a digital painting style with dramatic lighting and a focus on clear, understandable visuals.
